docs.title: BioMCP
docs.text: Single-binary CLI and MCP server for querying biomedical databases. One command grammar, compact markdown output, 15 entities across 15+ data sources.

docs.title: Binary install (recommended)
docs.text: curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/genomoncology/biomcp/main/install.sh | bash

docs.title: Install skills
docs.text:
Install guided investigation workflows into your agent directory:

biomcp skill install ~/.claude --force

docs.title: For Claude Desktop / Cursor / MCP clients
docs.text:
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "biomcp": {
      "command": "biomcp",
      "args": ["serve"]
    }
  }
}

docs.title: From source
docs.text: cargo build --release --locked

docs.title: Quick start
docs.text:
biomcp health --apis-only            # verify API connectivity
biomcp list                          # show all entities and commands
biomcp list gene                     # show gene-specific filters and examples

docs.title: Command grammar
docs.text:
search <entity> [filters]    → discovery
get <entity> <id> [sections] → focused detail
<entity> <helper> <id>       → cross-entity pivots
enrich <GENE1,GENE2,...>     → gene-set enrichment
batch <entity> <id1,id2,...> → parallel gets

docs.title: Entities and sources
docs.text: Entity Sources Example gene MyGene.info, UniProt, Reactome, QuickGO, STRING, CIViC biomcp get gene BRAF pathways variant MyVariant.info, ClinVar, gnomAD, CIViC, OncoKB, cBioPortal, GWAS Catalog, AlphaGenome biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" clinvar article PubMed, PubTator3, Europe PMC biomcp search article -g BRAF --limit 5 trial ClinicalTrials.gov, NCI CTS API biomcp search trial -c melanoma -s recruiting drug MyChem.info, ChEMBL, OpenTargets, Drugs\@FDA, CIViC biomcp get drug pembrolizumab targets disease Monarch Initiative, MONDO, CIViC, OpenTargets biomcp get disease "Lynch syndrome" genes pathway Reactome, g:Profiler biomcp get pathway R-HSA-5673001 genes protein UniProt, InterPro, STRING, PDB/AlphaFold biomcp get protein P15056 domains adverse-event OpenFDA (FAERS, MAUDE, Recalls) biomcp search adverse-event -d pembrolizumab pgx CPIC, PharmGKB biomcp get pgx CYP2D6 recommendations gwas GWAS Catalog biomcp search gwas --trait "type 2 diabetes" phenotype Monarch Initiative (HPO) biomcp search phenotype "HP:0001250" organization NCI CTS API biomcp search organization "Dana-Farber" intervention NCI CTS API biomcp search intervention pembrolizumab biomarker NCI CTS API biomcp search biomarker BRAF

docs.title: Cross-entity helpers
docs.text:
Pivot between related entities without rebuilding filters:

biomcp variant trials "BRAF V600E" --limit 5
biomcp variant articles "BRAF V600E"
biomcp drug adverse-events pembrolizumab
biomcp drug trials pembrolizumab
biomcp disease trials melanoma
biomcp disease drugs melanoma
biomcp gene articles BRCA1
biomcp gene pathways BRAF
biomcp pathway drugs R-HSA-5673001
biomcp protein structures P15056
biomcp article entities 22663011

docs.title: Gene-set enrichment
docs.text: biomcp enrich BRAF,KRAS,NRAS --limit 10

docs.title: Sections and progressive disclosure
docs.text:
Every get command supports selectable sections:

biomcp get gene BRAF                    # summary card
biomcp get gene BRAF pathways           # add pathway section
biomcp get gene BRAF civic interactions # multiple sections
biomcp get gene BRAF all                # everything

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" clinvar population conservation
biomcp get drug pembrolizumab label shortage targets approvals
biomcp get disease "Lynch syndrome" genes phenotypes variants
biomcp get trial NCT02576665 eligibility locations outcomes

docs.title: API keys
docs.text:
Most commands work without credentials. Optional keys improve rate limits:

export NCBI_API_KEY="..."        # PubTator, PMC OA, NCBI ID converter
export OPENFDA_API_KEY="..."     # OpenFDA rate limits
export NCI_API_KEY="..."         # NCI CTS (required for organization/intervention/biomarker)
export ONCOKB_TOKEN="..."        # OncoKB variant helper
export ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY="..." # AlphaGenome variant effect prediction

docs.title: Skills
docs.text: 14 guided investigation workflows are built in. See Skills for details.

docs.title: License
docs.text: MIT
Complete rewrite from Python to Rust. Single static binary, no runtime dependencies.

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text:
• Single-binary CLI and MCP server — no Python, no pip, no virtual environments
  • 15 biomedical data sources, unified command grammar, compact markdown output
  • 14 embedded skills (guided investigation workflows)
  • MCP server (stdio + SSE) with tool and resource support
  • HTTP proxy (serve-http) for multi-worker shared rate limiting
  • Production installer with SHA256 verification (5 platforms)
  • Progressive disclosure: search returns summaries, get returns full detail with selectable sections
  • NCBI API key support for improved rate limits
  • 429 retry with Retry-After backoff

docs.title: Data sources
docs.text: MyGene.info, MyVariant.info (ClinVar, gnomAD, CIViC, OncoKB), ClinicalTrials.gov, NCI CTS API, PubMed/PubTator3, MyChem.info, Monarch/MONDO, Reactome, UniProt, OpenFDA FAERS, PharmGKB/CPIC, GWAS Catalog, Monarch (phenotypes), AlphaGenome (gRPC).

docs.title: Breaking changes from Python BioMCP
docs.text:
• Python package biomcp-python is no longer maintained
  • MCP tool names and signatures have changed
  • Configuration via environment variables only
Legacy Python BioMCP. See branch python-0.7.3 for source code.

docs.title: License
docs.text: BioMCP is distributed under the MIT license.

docs.title: Data sources and terms
docs.text:
BioMCP queries third-party APIs. Each provider may have its own terms of service, attribution requirements, and rate limits.

See Data sources for the full list and which features depend on which APIs.

docs.title: Privacy and sensitive data
docs.text:
• Do not send protected health information (PHI) or other sensitive patient data to third-party APIs unless you have explicit authorization and your compliance team has approved the workflow.
  • Queries may be logged by upstream providers per their policies.

docs.title: Output and clinical use
docs.text: BioMCP is a research and workflow aid. Validate clinically relevant information against primary sources (labels, guidelines, original publications) and your institution's policies.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: BioMCP depends on multiple public biomedical APIs, so transient source failures are expected. This guide focuses on practical triage for API failures, slow responses, and environment issues. Start with health checks, then narrow to the affected entity and source.

docs.title: 1) Validate connectivity first
docs.text:
Run API-level checks before debugging entity-specific commands:

biomcp health --apis-only

If one source fails while others pass, the issue is usually upstream availability and not your local install.

docs.title: 2) MyGene / MyVariant intermittent failures
docs.text:
Gene and variant lookups rely on BioThings services (mygene.info, myvariant.info). These services can intermittently return 5xx or timeout responses during peak traffic.

What BioMCP already does:

  • Uses shared HTTP client timeouts (connect_timeout=10s, timeout=30s)
  • Retries transient failures with exponential backoff (up to 3 retries)
  • Uses HTTP cache to reduce repeat upstream calls

What to do when failures persist:

biomcp --no-cache search gene -q BRAF --limit 3
biomcp --no-cache get variant rs113488022

If --no-cache works while cached mode fails repeatedly, clear cache and retry:

rm -rf ~/.cache/biomcp/http-cacache

docs.title: 3) ClinicalTrials.gov API v2 quirks
docs.text:
ClinicalTrials.gov search behavior can vary with complex query combinations and pagination tokens. The most common symptoms are empty pages after filters or unstable totals between repeated calls.

Recommended steps:

  • Start with minimal filters (-c, --limit) and add one filter at a time.
  • Use explicit --source ctgov or --source nci to isolate source behavior.
  • Avoid changing both geographic and ESSIE filters in the same troubleshooting step.

Examples:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --source ctgov --limit 5
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --source nci --limit 5

docs.title: 4) OpenFDA FAERS / recall pagination limits
docs.text:
OpenFDA-backed searches are currently capped by BioMCP at --limit <= 50 per request. If you need more data, page your own workflow with narrower queries and repeated commands.

biomcp search adverse-event --drug pembrolizumab --limit 50
biomcp search adverse-event --type recall --classification "Class I" --limit 50

If you have an OpenFDA API key, export it to increase quota stability:

export OPENFDA_API_KEY="..."

docs.title: 5) PubTator annotation timeouts
docs.text:
Article annotation sections (annotations) require PubTator3 and can be slower than base PubMed retrieval. When this section is slow or fails, verify basic article lookup first.

biomcp get article 22663011
biomcp get article 22663011 annotations

If base lookup succeeds but annotations fail repeatedly, retry later and keep the workflow moving with base metadata.

docs.title: 6) AlphaGenome prediction connection issues
docs.text:
get variant <id> predict uses AlphaGenome over gRPC and requires an API key. Missing key or TLS/connectivity issues are the two most common failure paths.

Checklist:

  • Confirm ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY is set
  • Validate outbound access to gdmscience.googleapis.com
  • Retry with a known-good variant
export ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY="..."
biomcp get variant "chr7:g.140453136A>T" predict

docs.title: 7) NCI CTS API authentication failures
docs.text:
Trial searches with --source nci require NCI_API_KEY. If this key is missing, BioMCP returns an explicit ApiKeyRequired error.

export NCI_API_KEY="..."
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --source nci --limit 5

docs.title: 8) OncoKB enrichment appears limited
docs.text:
Without ONCOKB_TOKEN, BioMCP uses the OncoKB demo endpoint with reduced capability. Set a production token for full enrichment behavior.

export ONCOKB_TOKEN="..."
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E"

docs.title: 9) Date validation errors
docs.text:
Invalid dates are rejected before API calls. Use ISO format YYYY-MM-DD and valid calendar dates.

Examples that should fail immediately:

biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-13-01 --limit 1
biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-02-30 --limit 1

docs.title: 10) Install/update ownership conflicts
docs.text:
If biomcp update cannot replace the current binary (e.g. permission issues), re-run the installer:

curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/genomoncology/biomcp/main/install.sh | bash

docs.title: 11) Local build missing protoc
docs.text:
The project includes gRPC clients and requires protoc to build from source.

  • macOS: brew install protobuf
  • Ubuntu/Debian: apt-get install protobuf-compiler

docs.title: 12) Still blocked
docs.text:
Capture one failing command with full stderr and include:

  • BioMCP version (biomcp version)
  • Command and flags
  • Whether --no-cache changes behavior
  • Source-specific API key state (set or unset)

docs.title: Progressive Disclosure
docs.text:
Progressive disclosure is the primary interaction model in BioMCP.

The model is simple:

  1. search broadly,
  2. get a specific record,
  3. request only the section you need.

docs.title: Why this pattern exists
docs.text:
Biomedical APIs can return large nested payloads. Sending full payloads by default wastes time and context space.

Progressive disclosure keeps default output concise and predictable.

docs.title: Step 1: Search
docs.text:
Use search to identify candidates.

biomcp search article -g BRAF -d melanoma --limit 5

docs.title: Step 2: Get
docs.text:
Use get to anchor on a specific identifier.

biomcp get article 22663011

docs.title: Step 3: Expand by section
docs.text:
Request a specific section only when needed.

biomcp get article 22663011 fulltext

docs.title: Entity examples
docs.text:
Gene:

biomcp get gene BRAF
biomcp get gene BRAF pathways

Variant:

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E"
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" predict

Trial:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665
biomcp get trial NCT02576665 eligibility

Drug:

biomcp get drug carboplatin
biomcp get drug carboplatin shortage

docs.title: Operational benefits
docs.text:
• Lower token usage for LLM-based workflows.
  • Less irrelevant output in terminal usage.
  • Faster debugging because each request has a narrow scope.
  • Easier automation because command intent is explicit.

docs.title: Practical guidance
docs.text:
• Start with search when you are unsure of identifiers.
  • Use one section at a time before requesting multiple sections.
  • Keep --json for downstream systems that require structured parsing.

docs.title: Relationship to MCP resources
docs.text:
MCP resources in BioMCP encode this same pattern in reusable workflows.

Use resources when you need guidance on sequence, and tools when you are ready to execute commands.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text: Progressive disclosure is not a cosmetic choice. It is the mechanism that keeps BioMCP usable for both humans and agents at scale.

docs.title: What Is BioMCP?
docs.text:
BioMCP is a biomedical command-line interface and MCP server designed for practical research and clinical-informatics workflows.

It combines two ideas:

  1. A stable command grammar for entity retrieval and search.
  2. A protocol surface for agent runtimes through MCP tools and resources.

docs.title: Core goal
docs.text: The project goal is not to mirror every field from every API. The goal is to deliver dependable, compact answers that can be expanded on demand.

docs.title: The command grammar
docs.text:
BioMCP uses one consistent grammar:

  • search <entity> [filters]
  • get <entity> <id> [section...]

This grammar is intentionally shared across entities so users and agents do not need a different mental model per endpoint.

docs.title: Entities
docs.text:
BioMCP covers entities across clinical, research, and regulatory domains:

Core clinical entities: gene, variant, trial, article, drug, disease

Extended entities: pathway, protein, adverse-event, PGx (pharmacogenomics)

Discovery entities: GWAS, phenotype search, biomarker, organization, intervention

docs.title: Why this matters for agents
docs.text:
Agent runtimes often fail on data tooling for three reasons:

  • command discovery is inconsistent,
  • output is too verbose or unstable,
  • source provenance is unclear.

BioMCP addresses these with:

  • predictable commands,
  • compact markdown-first defaults,
  • explicit source mapping in docs.

docs.title: What BioMCP is not
docs.text:
BioMCP is not a local biomedical warehouse. It is also not a replacement for formal clinical interpretation systems.

It is a workflow interface that normalizes retrieval from trusted public APIs.

docs.title: Progressive detail
docs.text:
BioMCP starts concise, then expands by section.

Examples:

biomcp get gene BRAF
biomcp get gene BRAF pathways
biomcp get article 22663011
biomcp get article 22663011 fulltext

The first command gives orientation. The second command gives focused depth.

docs.title: MCP mode
docs.text:
biomcp serve runs a stdio MCP server.

The server advertises:

  • tools: one execution tool (shell)
  • resources: curated markdown help and pattern documents

This keeps client integration simple while preserving discoverability.

docs.title: Where BioMCP fits
docs.text:
BioMCP works well for:

  • trial searching triage,
  • variant-to-literature pivots,
  • disease normalization and downstream lookups,
  • adverse-event and recall quick checks.

docs.title: Design priorities
docs.text:
The design priorities are:

  • deterministic command behavior,
  • explicit error messages,
  • low context overhead,
  • documented API provenance,
  • CI-backed contract checks.

docs.title: Next reading
docs.text:
• Concept: Progressive disclosure
  • User guides: docs/user-guide/
  • Data provenance: docs/reference/data-sources.md
  • MCP behavior: docs/reference/mcp-server.md

docs.title: API Keys
docs.text: Most BioMCP workflows run without credentials. Some enrichment and higher-rate access paths improve with API keys.

docs.title: ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY
docs.text:
Used by variant prediction lookups:

export ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY="..."
biomcp get variant "chr7:g.140453136A>T" predict

docs.title: ONCOKB_TOKEN
docs.text:
Used for production OncoKB enrichment. If omitted, BioMCP uses the public/demo path when possible.

export ONCOKB_TOKEN="..."
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E"

docs.title: NCI_API_KEY
docs.text:
Used for NCI CTS trial calls.

export NCI_API_KEY="..."
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --source nci

docs.title: NCBI_API_KEY
docs.text:
Improves rate limits for PubTator, PMC OA, and NCBI ID converter (3 → 10 req/sec).

export NCBI_API_KEY="..."
biomcp search article -g BRAF --limit 5

docs.title: OPENFDA_API_KEY
docs.text:
Improves OpenFDA rate limits for drug safety lookups.

export OPENFDA_API_KEY="..."
biomcp search adverse-event --drug pembrolizumab --limit 5

docs.title: Key management guidance
docs.text:
• Prefer environment variables over hardcoded values.
  • Do not commit secrets into source control.
  • Set keys in the same environment used by your MCP client.
  • Rotate keys when sharing machines or CI runners.

docs.title: Claude Desktop (MCP) Setup
docs.text: BioMCP can run as an MCP server over stdio.

docs.title: Add BioMCP server config
docs.text:
Use biomcp serve as the MCP command:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "biomcp": {
      "command": "biomcp",
      "args": ["serve"]
    }
  }
}

If biomcp is not on your PATH, use the absolute path to the binary (e.g. ~/.local/bin/biomcp).

docs.title: Validate before connecting Claude
docs.text:
biomcp --version
biomcp health --apis-only

docs.title: Verify MCP-level behavior
docs.text:
When connected, clients should discover:

  • one tool: shell
  • one help resource (biomcp://help) and one resource per installed skill (biomcp://skill/<slug>)

Resource discovery gives agent clients structured entry points before execution.

docs.title: Operational tips
docs.text:
• Keep API keys in the client launch environment.
  • Restart Claude Desktop after config changes.
  • Prefer stable absolute paths in managed environments.

docs.title: First Query
docs.text: This walkthrough shows the shortest useful BioMCP session.

docs.title: 1. Confirm API connectivity
docs.text:
biomcp health --apis-only

You should see an API status table and a summary line.

docs.title: 2. Search for a target
docs.text:
biomcp search gene -q BRAF --limit 5

Use search to identify canonical identifiers before deeper retrieval.

docs.title: 3. Retrieve a specific record
docs.text: biomcp get gene BRAF

docs.title: 4. Expand with a section
docs.text:
biomcp get gene BRAF pathways

This positional section model is the default way to request deeper detail.

docs.title: 5. Try JSON output
docs.text: biomcp --json get gene BRAF

docs.title: 6. Cross to another entity
docs.text:
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --status recruiting --limit 3
biomcp get trial NCT02576665 eligibility

docs.title: What to do next
docs.text:
• Read progressive disclosure.
  • Open an entity guide in docs/user-guide/.
  • Configure optional keys in API keys.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
This page covers supported BioMCP installation paths and verification checks.

After installation, the biomcp command should be available in your shell.

docs.title: Option 1: Installer script (recommended)
docs.text:
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/genomoncology/biomcp/main/install.sh | bash

The installer downloads a prebuilt binary for your platform (Linux x86_64/arm64, macOS x86_64/arm64, Windows x86_64), verifies the SHA256 checksum, and places biomcp in ~/.local/bin.

Pin a specific version:

curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/genomoncology/biomcp/main/install.sh | bash -s -- --version 0.8.0

Verify:

biomcp --version

docs.title: Option 2: Source build
docs.text:
From a local checkout:

cargo build --release --locked
./target/release/biomcp --version

Install into Cargo bin path:

cargo install --path . --locked
biomcp --version

docs.title: Post-install smoke checks
docs.text:
biomcp list
biomcp health --apis-only
biomcp search gene -q BRAF --limit 1

docs.title: Environment notes
docs.text:
• Default output is markdown.
  • Use --json when a workflow needs structured output.
  • Optional API keys are documented in API keys.

docs.title: Troubleshooting quick hits
docs.text:
• Command not found: ensure install location is on PATH.
  • Build fails at protobuf step: install protoc.
  • Network-related health failures: retry and inspect upstream API status.

docs.title: Skills (Embedded Use Cases)
docs.text:
BioMCP bundles reusable workflow documents as embedded skills.

Skills are available to both CLI users and MCP clients via resources.

docs.title: List skills
docs.text:
biomcp skill
biomcp skill list

docs.title: Open a specific skill
docs.text:
By number:

biomcp skill 01

By slug:

biomcp skill variant-to-treatment

docs.title: Install into an agent directory
docs.text:
biomcp skill install ~/.claude

Force replace existing files:

biomcp skill install ~/.claude --force

When no directory is provided, BioMCP attempts supported agent-directory detection.

docs.title: Skill topics included
docs.text: # Slug Focus 01 variant-to-treatment Variant to treatment/evidence workflow 02 drug-investigation Drug mechanism, safety, alternatives 03 trial-searching Trial discovery + patient matching 04 rare-disease Rare disease evidence and trial strategy 05 drug-shortages Shortage monitoring and alternatives 06 advanced-therapies CAR-T/checkpoint therapy workflows 07 hereditary-cancer Hereditary syndrome workflows 08 resistance Resistance and next-line options 09 gene-function-lookup Gene-centric function and context lookup 10 gene-set-analysis Enrichment + pathway + interaction synthesis 11 literature-synthesis Evidence synthesis with cross-entity checks 12 pharmacogenomics PGx gene-drug interactions and dosing 13 phenotype-triage Symptom-first rare disease workup 14 protein-pathway Protein structure and pathway deep dive

docs.title: Relationship to MCP resources
docs.text: The same use cases are readable through resources/list and resources/read with biomcp://skill/<slug> URIs.

docs.title: How to: annotate variants
docs.text: BioMCP provides lightweight variant annotation suitable for triage and workflow automation.

docs.title: Choose an ID format
docs.text:
biomcp get variant supports:

  • rsID: rs113488022
  • HGVS genomic: chr7:g.140453136A>T
  • Gene + protein change: BRAF V600E

Examples:

biomcp get variant rs113488022
biomcp get variant "chr7:g.140453136A>T"
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E"

docs.title: Filter search results
docs.text:
biomcp search variant -g BRCA1 --significance pathogenic --limit 10

Add frequency and score filters:

biomcp search variant -g BRCA1 --max-frequency 0.01 --min-cadd 20 --limit 10

docs.title: Optional enrichments
docs.text:
• OncoKB (set ONCOKB_TOKEN for the production endpoint)
  • cBioPortal mutation summaries (best effort)

If these services are unavailable, BioMCP degrades gracefully and will still return core annotations.

docs.title: How To: Find Articles
docs.text: This guide shows practical literature-search patterns.

docs.title: Broad start
docs.text: biomcp search article -g BRAF --limit 10

docs.title: Add disease context
docs.text: biomcp search article -g BRAF -d melanoma --limit 10

docs.title: Constrain by date
docs.text: biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-01-01 --limit 10

docs.title: Exclude preprints when supported
docs.text: biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-01-01 --no-preprints --limit 10

docs.title: Pull the full text section
docs.text: biomcp get article 22663011 fulltext

docs.title: Follow-up pattern
docs.text:
After identifying key papers, pivot to trials or variants:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --mutation "BRAF V600E" --limit 5
biomcp search variant -g BRAF --limit 5

docs.title: How to: find trials
docs.text: This guide shows common trial-searching patterns.

docs.title: Baseline search
docs.text:
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --status recruiting --limit 10

Add intervention:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma -i pembrolizumab --status recruiting --limit 10

docs.title: Biomarker-aware filters (best effort)
docs.text:
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --mutation "BRAF V600E" --limit 10
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --biomarker BRAF --limit 10

docs.title: Geographic search
docs.text: biomcp search trial -c melanoma --lat 42.36 --lon -71.06 --distance 50 --limit 10

docs.title: Switch data sources
docs.text:
ClinicalTrials.gov (default):

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --source ctgov --limit 10

NCI CTS:

export NCI_API_KEY="..."
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --source nci --limit 10

docs.title: How To: Predict Effects
docs.text: BioMCP can request functional-impact predictions through the variant predict section.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Set ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY.
  • Prefer a resolvable genomic variant identifier.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
export ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY="..."
biomcp get variant "chr7:g.140453136A>T" predict

docs.title: Alternate input
docs.text: biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" predict

docs.title: Validation behavior
docs.text: BioMCP validates identifiers and dates before expensive network work. If a variant cannot be resolved to a supported prediction path, an explicit error or warning is returned.

docs.title: Practical guidance
docs.text:
• Use prediction output as one signal, not a final interpretation.
  • Pair predictions with variant annotations and literature context.

docs.title: Reproduce Paper Workflows with Skills
docs.text: BioMCP paper demos are consolidated into embedded skill workflows so any agent can run them without a custom runtime. Use this guide to map each paper-style task to the canonical skill and execution pattern.

docs.title: Mapping
docs.text: Paper-style workflow Canonical skill Typical command GeneGPT 09-gene-function-lookup biomcp skill gene-function-lookup GeneAgent 10-gene-set-analysis biomcp skill gene-set-analysis TrialGPT 03-trial-searching (patient matching section) biomcp skill 03 PubMed & Beyond 11-literature-synthesis biomcp skill literature-synthesis

docs.title: Basic Flow
docs.text:
1. List available workflows.
  2. Retrieve one by number or slug.
  3. Execute the included CLI steps.
  4. Verify results against that skill's validation checklist.
biomcp skill list
biomcp skill gene-function-lookup

docs.title: Suggested Execution Pattern
docs.text:
For a reproducible run, copy command output to a markdown log and keep IDs (PMIDs/NCT IDs) visible in the final summary.

biomcp skill 10
biomcp enrich "BRCA1,TP53,ATM,CHEK2,PALB2" --limit 10
biomcp get gene BRCA1 pathways

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Skills are model agnostic; any shell-capable agent can execute them.
  • If a service is temporarily rate limited, retry after a short pause.
  • If enrichment is unavailable, continue with pathway/interaction/literature verification steps in skill 10.

docs.title: Skill Validation Guide
docs.text: This guide defines how to evaluate whether a BioMCP skill run is complete and trustworthy. Validation is checklist-driven and attached directly to each skill markdown file.

docs.title: Validation Model
docs.text:
Each skill should provide:

  1. Quick Check to confirm command path health.
  2. Full Workflow with explicit step intent.
  3. Validation Checklist with concrete expected outcomes.

A run is considered valid when checklist items can be traced to command output.

docs.title: Reviewer Checklist
docs.text:
Use this short rubric when reviewing a skill execution log:

Criterion Pass condition Command fidelity Steps match the skill workflow commands Evidence traceability Output includes IDs (PMID/NCT/variant IDs) where relevant Clinical relevance Summary ties findings back to disease/variant/drug context Constraint awareness Eligibility/safety/limitations noted when applicable Reproducibility Another reviewer can rerun commands and get equivalent structure

docs.title: Common Failure Patterns
docs.text:
• Commands run out of order and lose context.
  • Final summary omits the evidence IDs returned by commands.
  • Trial matching lacks criterion-level explanation.
  • Resistance and alternative-treatment claims are made without supporting queries.

docs.title: Practical Tips
docs.text:
• Keep raw output snippets for each checklist line item.
  • Prefer explicit command reruns over inferred claims.
  • Mark no-result cases clearly (for example, no recruiting trials found) rather than leaving gaps.

docs.title: Article Keyword Search
docs.text: This reference documents keyword query behavior for biomcp search article.

docs.title: Keyword behavior
docs.text:
--keyword (-k) is treated as escaped free text and no longer auto-quotes whitespace-containing values.

This allows multi-word keyword retrieval such as:

biomcp search article -k "large language model clinical trials" --limit 5

docs.title: Phrase behavior for entity filters
docs.text:
Entity-oriented filters retain phrase quoting behavior:

  • --gene
  • --disease
  • --drug
  • --author

Example:

biomcp search article -g "BRAF V600E" --author "Jane Doe" --limit 5

docs.title: Combined filters
docs.text:
Filters can be combined with date and preprint controls:

biomcp search article -g BRAF -k "immune checkpoint blockade" --since 2024-01-01 --no-preprints --limit 10

docs.title: Benchmarks
docs.text:
This page defines practical benchmark patterns for BioMCP.

The objective is reproducible command behavior, not synthetic leaderboard numbers.

docs.title: Benchmark goals
docs.text:
• Compare latency across entities.
  • Track output-size drift.
  • Validate cache behavior.
  • Catch regressions in command startup overhead.

docs.title: Baseline command set
docs.text:
Use a fixed baseline so runs are comparable over time.

biomcp get gene BRAF
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E"
biomcp get trial NCT02576665
biomcp search article -g BRAF --limit 5

docs.title: Latency measurement
docs.text:
Use repeated runs and report median + spread.

Example with hyperfine:

hyperfine -m 10 'biomcp get gene BRAF' 'biomcp search trial -c melanoma --limit 5'

Recommendations:

  • run on stable network,
  • avoid mixed-background workloads,
  • capture raw command outputs for auditing.

docs.title: Output-size tracking
docs.text:
Track markdown and JSON sizes independently.

biomcp get gene BRAF | wc -c
biomcp --json get gene BRAF | wc -c

Why this matters:

  • markdown size impacts prompt context cost,
  • JSON size affects API and queue throughput,
  • sudden growth can signal response-shape regressions.

docs.title: Cache-behavior checks
docs.text:
Compare first call vs second call for cache-eligible endpoints.

biomcp get article 22663011
biomcp get article 22663011

Capture timing for both runs to verify expected improvement.

docs.title: Date-validation contract checks
docs.text:
Invalid dates should fail before network calls.

Examples:

biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-13-01 --limit 1
biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-02-30 --limit 1

Expected behavior:

  • immediate validation error,
  • no long wait for upstream API timeouts.

docs.title: Cache-directory contract checks
docs.text:
Downloaded artifacts should use platform cache paths.

Use command help and health output to validate paths in your environment.

docs.title: Reporting template
docs.text:
When sharing benchmark results, include:

  • command list,
  • machine details,
  • network assumptions,
  • cache warm/cold status,
  • median and p95 latency,
  • output byte counts.

docs.title: Caveats
docs.text:
• Public APIs can throttle unpredictably.
  • Upstream schema changes can affect command duration.
  • Geographic distance to API hosts influences baseline latency.

docs.title: Recommended cadence
docs.text:
• Run quick checks on every release candidate.
  • Run fuller benchmark suites before major parser or rendering changes.

docs.title: CIViC Sections
docs.text: BioMCP exposes CIViC as explicit, section-gated enrichment.

docs.title: Variant
docs.text:
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" civic

Returns cached CIViC evidence from MyVariant plus GraphQL-enriched evidence and assertions when available.

docs.title: Gene
docs.text:
biomcp get gene BRAF civic

Returns CIViC evidence/assertion totals and representative rows for the gene query.

docs.title: Drug
docs.text:
biomcp get drug vemurafenib civic

Returns CIViC therapy-context evidence and assertions.

docs.title: Disease
docs.text:
biomcp get disease melanoma civic

Returns CIViC disease-context evidence and assertions.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• CIViC sections are opt-in and are not included in compact default output.
  • all includes CIViC where supported:
  • biomcp get variant <id> all
  • biomcp get gene <symbol> all
  • biomcp get drug <name> all
  • biomcp get disease <name_or_id> all

docs.title: Data Sources
docs.text: BioMCP unifies multiple biomedical data providers behind one CLI grammar. This reference explains source provenance, authentication requirements, base endpoints, and operational caveats so users can reason about result quality and troubleshooting.

docs.title: Source matrix

docs.title: Global HTTP behavior
docs.text:
All HTTP-based sources share a common client with:

  • Connect timeout: 10 seconds
  • Request timeout: 30 seconds
  • Retries: exponential backoff, up to 3 retries for transient failures
  • Disk cache: ~/.cache/biomcp/http-cacache (platform-adjusted cache root)

For freshness-sensitive workflows, use --no-cache.

docs.title: Authentication requirements
docs.text:
BioMCP only requires API keys for a subset of sources.

Source Environment variable Required when AlphaGenome ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY Running get variant <id> predict NCI CTS API NCI_API_KEY Trial operations with --source nci, or search organization/intervention/biomarker OncoKB ONCOKB_TOKEN Running variant oncokb <id> OpenFDA OPENFDA_API_KEY Optional; improves quota headroom

docs.title: Source-specific rate and payload constraints
docs.text:
Upstream services can change quotas without notice, so BioMCP documents enforced limits and practical ceilings observed in command behavior.

Source / command path BioMCP-enforced limit Practical guidance OpenFDA adverse-event / recall / device --limit must be 1-50 Use narrower filters and iterative queries for large pulls Gene search --limit must be 1-50 Start with small limits, then increase Variant search --limit must be 1-50 Use --gene + --consequence to reduce noise PGx (CPIC) Rate-limited to 1 request / 250ms Keep result limits focused around target gene/drug PGx annotations (PharmGKB) Rate-limited to 1 request / 500ms Treat as enrichment; core PGx data remains from CPIC GWAS search (search gwas) --limit must be 1-50 Prefer specific gene or trait queries to avoid broad result sets Trial search --limit defaults to 10, supports pagination Use --offset to page and keep filters stable Article search --limit defaults to 10 Use --since and entity filters to constrain results

docs.title: Trial source behavior
docs.text:
BioMCP supports two trial backends with similar command syntax but different retrieval behavior.

Source flag Backend Strengths Caveats --source ctgov (default) ClinicalTrials.gov API v2 No API key, broad public coverage Query behavior can vary with complex advanced terms --source nci NCI CTS API Alternative indexing, oncology-focused source Requires NCI_API_KEY and NCI-specific availability

docs.title: Article pipeline behavior
docs.text:
Article workflows compose multiple APIs for different tasks:

  1. Europe PMC / PubMed for search and bibliographic metadata
  2. PubTator3 for annotations
  3. NCBI ID converter + PMC OA for full-text resolution where available

This means metadata, annotations, and fulltext may have different availability for the same PMID.

docs.title: OpenFDA behavior
docs.text:
OpenFDA drives three BioMCP features:

  • FAERS drug adverse events
  • Drug/device recalls
  • MAUDE device events

OpenFDA may return no results for highly specific filters even when broader filters succeed. Start broad (--drug, --type) and then tighten with --reaction, --outcome, --classification, or date filters.

docs.title: Provenance expectations
docs.text:
BioMCP output intentionally preserves source identity and record identifiers. Users should always be able to trace:

  • Which source produced the data
  • Which identifier anchors the record (e.g., NCT, PMID, MONDO, rsID)
  • Which sections come from direct source fields vs normalized rendering

docs.title: Operations checklist
docs.text:
When debugging source discrepancies:

  1. Run biomcp health --apis-only
  2. Retry with --no-cache
  3. Confirm required API keys are set for optional sources
  4. Switch source when applicable (--source ctgov vs --source nci)
  5. Reduce filter complexity and retest

docs.title: Related docs
docs.text:
• Quick Reference
  • Error Codes
  • Troubleshooting

docs.title: Drug Approvals and Adverse-Event Summary
docs.text: This reference covers the new Drugs@FDA approvals section and FAERS summary statistics.

docs.title: Drug approvals (Drugs@FDA)
docs.text:
Use the approvals section on drug entities:

biomcp get drug dabrafenib approvals

The section includes:

  • application number (NDA/BLA),
  • sponsor,
  • key product rows (brand/dosage form/route/status),
  • submission timeline rows (type/number/status/date).

docs.title: FAERS summary statistics
docs.text:
FAERS search responses include summary metadata above the report table:

biomcp search adverse-event -d pembrolizumab --limit 10

Summary fields:

  • total reports from OpenFDA metadata,
  • returned report count,
  • top reactions with count and percentage.

The same summary appears in:

biomcp drug adverse-events pembrolizumab --limit 10

docs.title: Error Codes
docs.text: BioMCP exposes structured internal error variants through human-readable CLI messages. This reference maps each BioMcpError variant to likely causes and practical recovery steps.

docs.title: Error catalog
docs.text: Error variant Meaning Recovery guidance HttpClientInit HTTP client could not initialize Check TLS/network stack, proxy settings, and local certificate configuration Http HTTP request failed before receiving a successful response Retry the command and verify network connectivity HttpMiddleware Retry/cache middleware failed Retry; if persistent, clear cache and re-run with --no-cache Api Upstream API returned an error response Check API status, input values, and any source-specific constraints ApiJson API response shape changed or returned malformed JSON Retry once; if repeatable, report issue because upstream format may have changed NotFound Requested entity ID was not found Verify identifier format; run search before get when unsure InvalidArgument Command arguments are invalid or inconsistent Re-run with --help and correct flag values/section names ApiKeyRequired Source requires an API key that is not set Export the listed environment variable and retry SourceUnavailable Requested source could not be used Switch sources if possible or retry later Template Markdown/templating render failed Report issue (rendering bug) Json Local JSON serialization/deserialization failed Retry; if persistent, report issue with command and payload context Io File system I/O failed Check permissions, available disk space, and install/cache paths

docs.title: Key environment variables
docs.text: Variable Used by ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY Variant predict section NCI_API_KEY Trial source --source nci ONCOKB_TOKEN Production OncoKB enrichment OPENFDA_API_KEY Optional OpenFDA quota stability

docs.title: Not-found troubleshooting pattern
docs.text:
When you get a NotFound error, validate in this order:

  1. Identifier syntax (rs..., NCT..., PMID, MONDO:...)
  2. Search by keyword or symbol
  3. Retry with a broader query

Examples:

biomcp search gene -q BRAF --limit 5
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --limit 5
biomcp search disease -q melanoma --limit 5

docs.title: Related docs
docs.text:
• Troubleshooting
  • Data Sources

docs.title: Does BioMCP require API keys?
docs.text:
No for most workflows.

Optional keys improve access for specific enrichments and source variants. See API keys.

docs.title: Where are cached files stored?
docs.text:
BioMCP uses platform cache directories.

Typical locations:

  • Linux: ~/.cache/biomcp/
  • macOS: ~/Library/Caches/biomcp/

The cache generally contains:

  • http-cacache/ for HTTP responses,
  • downloads/ for retrieved text artifacts.

docs.title: Why do invalid dates fail immediately?
docs.text:
Date validation is performed before network calls.

Examples of invalid inputs:

  • 2024-13-01 (invalid month)
  • 2024-02-30 (invalid day)
  • 2023-02-29 (non-leap-year day)

This behavior provides immediate feedback and avoids unnecessary API requests.

docs.title: How do I request full article text now?
docs.text:
Use positional sections:

biomcp get article 22663011 fulltext

The same model applies to other entities:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 eligibility
biomcp get gene BRAF pathways
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" predict

docs.title: How do I use BioMCP with Claude Desktop?
docs.text: Configure an MCP server entry using biomcp serve. See Claude Desktop setup.

docs.title: Why are some fields missing?
docs.text:
BioMCP returns concise defaults and depends on upstream source completeness.

When you need more detail:

  1. request a section,
  2. switch to JSON,
  3. verify source availability with biomcp health --apis-only.

docs.title: How do I inspect available commands quickly?
docs.text:
biomcp list
biomcp list trial
biomcp list variant

docs.title: Is BioMCP suitable for final clinical decisions?
docs.text: BioMCP is a retrieval and workflow tool. Clinical decisions require domain-expert review and institutional validation processes.

docs.title: How do I report reproducible issues?
docs.text:
Include:

  • exact command,
  • expected vs actual behavior,
  • biomcp --version,
  • relevant environment details,
  • whether the issue reproduces with --json.

docs.title: MCP Server Reference
docs.text: BioMCP exposes one execution tool (shell) and a curated resource catalog for agent guidance. This page documents the stable MCP contract and executes lightweight checks against the source tree.

docs.title: Capability Advertisement
docs.text:
The server must advertise both tools and resources.

Capability Required tools enabled resources enabled 
from pathlib import Path

repo_root = Path.cwd()
shell = (repo_root / "src/mcp/shell.rs").read_text()
assert "enable_tools()" in shell
assert "enable_resources()" in shell

docs.title: Resource Catalog
docs.text:
BioMCP publishes a help resource plus one markdown resource per registered skill use-case.

URI Name biomcp://help BioMCP Overview biomcp://skill/<slug> Pattern: <title> 
import re
from pathlib import Path

repo_root = Path.cwd()
shell = (repo_root / "src/mcp/shell.rs").read_text()
assert "RESOURCE_HELP_URI" in shell
assert 'uri: RESOURCE_HELP_URI.to_string()' in shell
assert 'name: "BioMCP Overview".to_string()' in shell
assert "list_use_case_refs()" in shell
assert 'format!("biomcp://skill/{}", skill.slug)' in shell
assert 'name = if title.to_ascii_lowercase().starts_with("pattern:")' in shell
assert len(set(re.findall(r"biomcp://[a-z0-9/-]+", shell))) >= 2

docs.title: Resource Read Mapping
docs.text:
• biomcp://help maps to show_overview().
  • Skill URIs map to show_use_case(<slug>).
  • All successful reads return text/markdown.
from pathlib import Path

repo_root = Path.cwd()
shell = (repo_root / "src/mcp/shell.rs").read_text()
assert "show_overview()" in shell
assert 'if let Some(slug) = uri.strip_prefix("biomcp://skill/")' in shell
assert "show_use_case(slug)" in shell
assert 'mime_type: Some("text/markdown".to_string())' in shell

docs.title: Unknown URI Behavior
docs.text:
Unknown resource URIs must return an MCP resource-not-found error and include a helpful message.

from pathlib import Path

repo_root = Path.cwd()
shell = (repo_root / "src/mcp/shell.rs").read_text()
assert "resource_not_found" in shell
assert "Unknown resource:" in shell

docs.title: Companion Runtime Tests
docs.text:
Protocol-level checks are implemented in Python integration tests:

  • tests/conftest.py
  • tests/test_mcp_contract.py

These tests run a real biomcp serve session over stdio and validate:

  • initialize handshake,
  • tools inventory,
  • resource inventory,
  • resource reads,
  • invalid URI error semantics.
from pathlib import Path

repo_root = Path.cwd()
assert (repo_root / "tests/conftest.py").exists()
assert (repo_root / "tests/test_mcp_contract.py").exists()

docs.title: Quick Reference
docs.text: This page is the high-signal command and vocabulary reference for day-to-day BioMCP use. It focuses on frequently used commands, common filter values, and domain constants that are useful for oncology and translational workflows.

docs.title: Install
docs.text: curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/genomoncology/biomcp/main/install.sh | bash

docs.title: Core command grammar
docs.text:
biomcp search <entity> [filters]       # discovery
biomcp get <entity> <id> [section...]  # focused detail
biomcp <entity> <helper> <id>          # cross-entity pivots
biomcp enrich <GENE1,GENE2,...>        # gene-set enrichment
biomcp batch <entity> <id1,id2,...>    # parallel gets

docs.title: Common lookups
docs.text:
biomcp get gene BRAF
biomcp get gene BRAF pathways
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E"
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" clinvar
biomcp get article 22663011
biomcp get article 22663011 fulltext
biomcp get trial NCT02576665
biomcp get trial NCT02576665 eligibility
biomcp get drug carboplatin shortage
biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105
biomcp get pathway R-HSA-5673001 genes
biomcp get protein P15056 domains
biomcp variant oncokb "BRAF V600E"

docs.title: Common searches
docs.text:
biomcp search gene -q BRAF --limit 5
biomcp search variant -g BRCA1 --significance pathogenic --limit 5
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --status recruiting --phase 2 --limit 5
biomcp search article -g BRAF -d melanoma --since 2024-01-01 --limit 5
biomcp search pathway -q "MAPK signaling" --limit 5
biomcp search protein -q kinase --limit 5
biomcp search adverse-event --drug pembrolizumab --serious --limit 5

docs.title: Output modes and discovery commands
docs.text:
biomcp --json search gene -q BRAF --limit 3
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --limit 3
biomcp list
biomcp list trial
biomcp health --apis-only
biomcp version

docs.title: Helper pivots
docs.text:
biomcp variant trials "BRAF V600E" --limit 3
biomcp drug adverse-events pembrolizumab --limit 3
biomcp disease drugs melanoma --limit 3
biomcp gene pathways BRAF
biomcp pathway drugs R-HSA-5673001 --limit 3
biomcp protein structures P15056

docs.title: Common gene aliases
docs.text:
Use these aliases in search when a clinical report or paper does not use the HGNC symbol. Follow with get gene <SYMBOL> once you identify the canonical symbol.

Alias in literature Official symbol HER1 EGFR HER2 ERBB2 P53 TP53 C-KIT KIT PD-1 PDCD1 PD-L1 CD274 MLH-1 MLH1 MSH-2 MSH2

docs.title: Trial geographic search quick coordinates
docs.text:
Use --lat, --lon, and --distance for trial site proximity filtering. Coordinates below are common starting points for regional searches.

City State Latitude Longitude Boston MA 42.3601 -71.0589 New York NY 40.7128 -74.0060 Chicago IL 41.8781 -87.6298 Houston TX 29.7604 -95.3698 Los Angeles CA 34.0522 -118.2437 San Francisco CA 37.7749 -122.4194 Seattle WA 47.6062 -122.3321 Atlanta GA 33.7490 -84.3880

Example:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --lat 42.3601 --lon -71.0589 --distance 50 --limit 5

docs.title: Trial status values
docs.text:
--status accepts ClinicalTrials.gov style recruitment states. Common values:

Status value Meaning recruiting Currently enrolling participants not yet recruiting Opened but enrollment not started active, not recruiting Ongoing study, enrollment closed completed Study finished terminated Stopped early suspended Temporarily paused withdrawn Stopped before enrollment unknown status Last known status is unclear

docs.title: Trial phase values
docs.text:
--phase accepts either numeric shorthand or explicit phase labels.

Input Interpreted as 1 PHASE1 2 PHASE2 3 PHASE3 4 PHASE4 phase1 PHASE1 phase2 PHASE2 phase3 PHASE3 phase4 PHASE4

docs.title: Clinical significance values (variant search)
docs.text:
Use these with biomcp search variant --significance <value>.

Significance value Typical interpretation pathogenic Strong evidence for disease association likely_pathogenic Evidence leans disease-associated uncertain_significance Evidence is currently inconclusive likely_benign Evidence leans non-pathogenic benign Strong evidence against pathogenicity conflicting_interpretations Submitters disagree risk_factor Associated with risk, not deterministic

docs.title: Variant consequence values
docs.text:
Use these with biomcp search variant --consequence <value>.

Consequence value Description missense_variant Amino acid substitution nonsense_variant Introduces stop codon synonymous_variant No amino acid change frameshift_variant Reading-frame disruption splice_acceptor_variant Splice acceptor disruption splice_donor_variant Splice donor disruption inframe_deletion In-frame codon deletion inframe_insertion In-frame codon insertion stop_lost Stop codon removed start_lost Start codon removed

docs.text:
• CLI Reference
  • Data Sources
  • Troubleshooting

docs.title: Source Versioning Matrix
docs.text:
This matrix tracks which upstream API endpoints are version-pinned and where unversioned endpoints remain intentional.

Source Base URL Version status Rationale Last reviewed AlphaGenome https://gdmscience.googleapis.com:443 Unversioned Google endpoint is service-versioned server-side; no stable path segment exposed 2026-02-15 cBioPortal https://www.cbioportal.org/api Unversioned Public API path is stable without explicit version segment 2026-02-15 ChEMBL https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chembl/api/data Unversioned ChEMBL data API is stable at /api/data; no URL version convention 2026-02-15 ClinicalTrials.gov https://clinicaltrials.gov/api/v2 Versioned (v2) Endpoint already pinned to public v2 API 2026-02-15 Enrichr https://maayanlab.cloud/Enrichr Unversioned Service does not publish versioned path variant for current API 2026-02-15 Europe PMC https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest Unversioned REST root is stable and not versioned in URL 2026-02-15 gnomAD GraphQL https://gnomad.broadinstitute.org/api Unversioned Versioning is dataset-level (gnomad_r4, gnomad_r3, gnomad_r2_1) in query payload 2026-02-15 g:Profiler https://biit.cs.ut.ee/gprofiler/api Unversioned Public endpoint does not expose version path segment 2026-02-15 HPO JAX API https://ontology.jax.org/api/hp Unversioned API path is canonical and currently unversioned 2026-02-15 InterPro https://www.ebi.ac.uk/interpro/api Unversioned Public endpoint has no URL versioning model 2026-02-15 MyChem.info https://mychem.info/v1 Versioned (v1) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 MyDisease.info https://mydisease.info/v1 Versioned (v1) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 MyGene.info https://mygene.info/v3 Versioned (v3) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 MyVariant.info https://myvariant.info/v1 Versioned (v1) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 NCBI ID Converter https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/tools/idconv/api/v1/articles Versioned (v1) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 NCI CTS https://clinicaltrialsapi.cancer.gov/api/v2 Versioned (v2) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 OncoKB (prod/demo) https://www.oncokb.org/api/v1 / https://demo.oncokb.org/api/v1 Versioned (v1) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 OpenFDA https://api.fda.gov Unversioned Public OpenFDA API is path-stable without version segment 2026-02-15 OpenTargets https://api.platform.opentargets.org/api/v4/graphql Versioned (v4) Endpoint already pinned 2026-02-15 PMC OA https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/utils/oa/oa.fcgi Unversioned Legacy utility endpoint; no version path available 2026-02-15 PubTator3 https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/research/pubtator3-api Versioned-by-product (pubtator3) Version identity is in product namespace 2026-02-15 QuickGO https://www.ebi.ac.uk/QuickGO/services Unversioned Service endpoint is canonical and not path-versioned 2026-02-15 Reactome Content Service https://reactome.org/ContentService Unversioned No explicit major version path in public endpoint 2026-02-15 STRING https://string-db.org/api Unversioned API route uses format path segment; no stable version URL segment 2026-02-15 UniProt REST https://rest.uniprot.org Unversioned REST base is canonical and not versioned in URL 2026-02-15

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• If a provider introduces a stable version path, update the corresponding src/sources/*.rs base constant and this table in the same change.
  • gnomAD versioning is handled by dataset selection in GraphQL variables and is verified by dataset fallback tests.

docs.title: Adverse Event
docs.text:
Use adverse-event commands for FDA safety surveillance across three datasets:

  • FAERS reports,
  • recall notices,
  • device events.

docs.title: Search FAERS reports
docs.text:
By drug:

biomcp search adverse-event --drug pembrolizumab --limit 5

Serious reports only:

biomcp search adverse-event --drug pembrolizumab --serious --limit 5

Reaction-focused filter:

biomcp search adverse-event --drug pembrolizumab --reaction pneumonitis --limit 5

docs.title: Search recall notices
docs.text:
biomcp search adverse-event --type recall --drug metformin --limit 5

Classification filter:

biomcp search adverse-event --type recall --drug metformin --classification "Class I" --limit 5

docs.title: Search device events (MAUDE)
docs.text:
biomcp search adverse-event --type device --device "insulin pump" --limit 5

Manufacturer filter:

biomcp search adverse-event --type device --manufacturer Medtronic --limit 5

Product-code filter:

biomcp search adverse-event --type device --product-code PQP --limit 5

--manufacturer and --product-code are valid only with --type device.

docs.title: Get a report by ID
docs.text:
biomcp get adverse-event 10222779

Report resolution is source-aware and returns the corresponding markdown format.

docs.title: Request report sections
docs.text:
Section Description reactions Adverse reactions reported outcomes Reaction outcomes (death, hospitalization, etc.) concomitant Concomitant medications guidance Safety guidance and labeling all Include all sections 
biomcp get adverse-event 10222779 reactions outcomes
biomcp get adverse-event 10222779 all

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json get adverse-event 10222779

docs.title: Practical guidance
docs.text:
• Include drug generic names for better FAERS recall.
  • Treat counts as signal, not incidence estimates.
  • Validate serious findings through full source documents when needed.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Drug
  • FAQ
  • Troubleshooting

docs.title: Article
docs.text: Use article commands for literature retrieval by disease, gene, drug, and identifier.

docs.title: Typical article workflow
docs.text:
1. search a topic,
  2. choose an identifier,
  3. retrieve default summary,
  4. request full text or annotations only when needed.

docs.title: Search articles
docs.text:
By gene and disease:

biomcp search article -g BRAF -d melanoma --limit 5

By keyword:

biomcp search article -k "immunotherapy resistance" --limit 5

By date:

biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-01-01 --limit 5

Exclude preprints when supported by source metadata:

biomcp search article -g BRAF --since 2024-01-01 --no-preprints --limit 5

docs.title: Get an article
docs.text:
Supported IDs include PMID, PMCID, and DOI.

biomcp get article 22663011

docs.title: Request specific sections
docs.text:
Full text section:

biomcp get article 22663011 fulltext

Annotation section:

biomcp get article 22663011 annotations

docs.title: Helper commands
docs.text: biomcp article entities 22663011   # extract annotated entities via PubTator

docs.title: Caching behavior
docs.text: Downloaded content is stored in the BioMCP cache directory. This avoids repeated large payload downloads during iterative workflows.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json get article 22663011

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Start with narrow --limit values.
  • Add a disease term when gene-only search is too broad.
  • Use section requests to avoid oversized responses.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Gene
  • Trial
  • How to find articles

docs.title: Biomarker
docs.text: Use biomarker commands to search clinical trial biomarker criteria from the NCI Clinical Trials Search API.

docs.title: Search biomarkers
docs.text:
By name:

biomcp search biomarker BRAF

By type:

biomcp search biomarker --type "Antigen" --limit 5

With eligibility filter:

biomcp search biomarker --eligibility inclusion --limit 10

By assay purpose:

biomcp search biomarker --assay-purpose "Eligibility Criterion - Inclusion"

By NCI thesaurus code:

biomcp search biomarker --code C17965 --limit 5

docs.title: Search filters
docs.text:
Flag Description -q/--query Biomarker name or keyword --type Biomarker type (e.g., Antigen, Gene) --eligibility Eligibility context --assay-purpose Assay purpose filter --code NCI thesaurus code -l/--limit Max results --offset Pagination offset

Biomarker is search-only. There is no get subcommand.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json search biomarker BRAF

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Use biomarker search to discover how a marker is used across trial eligibility criteria.
  • Combine with trial and intervention searches for full protocol context.
  • NCI thesaurus codes provide exact biomarker lookups.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Trial
  • Gene
  • Intervention

docs.title: CLI Reference
docs.text: BioMCP provides one command family with entity-oriented subcommands.

docs.title: Global options
docs.text:
• --json: return structured JSON output
  • --no-cache: bypass HTTP cache for the current command

docs.title: Core command patterns
docs.text:
biomcp search <entity> [filters]
biomcp get <entity> <id> [section...]

Section names are positional trailing arguments after <id>.

docs.title: Top-level commands
docs.text:
biomcp search ...
biomcp get ...
biomcp enrich <GENE1,GENE2,...> [--limit N]
biomcp batch <entity> <id1,id2,...> [--sections ...] [--source ...]
biomcp health [--apis-only]
biomcp list [entity]
biomcp skill [list|install|<name>]
biomcp mcp
biomcp serve
biomcp serve-http [--host 127.0.0.1] [--port 8080]
biomcp update [--check]
biomcp uninstall
biomcp version

docs.title: Gene
docs.text: biomcp search gene -q BRAF --limit 10 --offset 0

docs.title: Disease
docs.text: biomcp search disease -q melanoma --source mondo --limit 10 --offset 0

docs.text:
biomcp search pgx -g CYP2D6 --limit 10
biomcp search pgx -d warfarin --limit 10

docs.title: GWAS

docs.title: Article

docs.title: Trial

docs.title: Organization (NCI CTS)

docs.title: Intervention (NCI CTS)

docs.title: Biomarker (NCI CTS)

biomcp search biomarker -q "PD-L1" --type reference_gene --limit 5 --offset 0

NCI vocabulary search commands require NCI_API_KEY.

docs.title: Variant

docs.title: Drug

docs.text:

biomcp search protein -q kinase --all-species --limit 5

docs.title: Adverse event
docs.text:
biomcp search adverse-event --drug pembrolizumab --serious --limit 5 --offset 0
biomcp search adverse-event --type device --manufacturer Medtronic --limit 5
biomcp search adverse-event --type device --product-code PQP --limit 5

docs.text:
biomcp get gene BRAF
biomcp get gene BRAF pathways
biomcp get gene BRAF diseases

biomcp get disease melanoma
biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 genes phenotypes
biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 variants models

docs.text:

biomcp get pgx warfarin annotations

docs.text:
biomcp get article 22663011
biomcp get article 22663011 fulltext

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 eligibility

docs.title: MCP mode
docs.text:
• biomcp serve runs the stdio MCP server.
  • biomcp serve-http runs MCP over HTTP/SSE.

See also: docs/reference/mcp-server.md.

docs.title: Helper command families
docs.text:
biomcp variant trials "BRAF V600E"
biomcp variant oncokb "BRAF V600E"
biomcp drug adverse-events pembrolizumab
biomcp disease drugs melanoma
biomcp gene pathways BRAF
biomcp pathway drugs R-HSA-5673001
biomcp protein structures P15056

docs.title: Batch mode
docs.text:
biomcp batch gene BRAF,TP53
biomcp batch gene BRAF,TP53 --sections pathways,interactions
biomcp batch trial NCT02576665,NCT03715933 --source nci
biomcp batch variant "BRAF V600E","KRAS G12D" --json

docs.title: Disease
docs.text: Use disease commands for normalization and disease-centric cross-entity pivots.

docs.title: Search diseases
docs.text:
biomcp search disease -q melanoma --limit 5
biomcp search disease -q glioblastoma --source mondo --limit 5

Search resolves common labels toward canonical ontology-backed identifiers.

docs.title: Get disease records
docs.text:
By label:

biomcp get disease melanoma

By MONDO identifier:

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105

docs.title: Disease sections
docs.text:
Genes (Monarch-backed associations with relationship/source when available):

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 genes

Phenotypes (HPO phenotypes with qualifiers):

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 phenotypes

Variants (Monarch disease-associated variants):

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 variants

Models (Monarch model-organism evidence):

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 models

Pathways (associated pathways):

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 pathways

Prevalence (prevalence data):

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 prevalence

CIViC (clinical evidence):

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 civic

Combined sections:

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 genes phenotypes variants models
biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 all

docs.title: Phenotype-to-disease search
docs.text:
Use HPO term sets for ranked disease candidates:

biomcp search phenotype "HP:0001250 HP:0001263" --limit 10

You can pass terms space-separated or comma-separated.

docs.title: Typical disease-centric workflow
docs.text:
1. Normalize disease label.
  2. Pull disease sections (genes, phenotypes, variants, models) for context.
  3. Use normalized concept for trial or article searches.

Example:

biomcp get disease MONDO:0005105 genes phenotypes
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --status recruiting --limit 5
biomcp search article -d melanoma --limit 5

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text:
biomcp --json get disease MONDO:0005105 all
biomcp --json search phenotype "HP:0001250 HP:0001263"

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Prefer MONDO IDs in automation workflows.
  • Keep raw labels in user-facing notes for readability.
  • Pair disease normalization with biomarker filters for trial matching.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Trial
  • Article
  • Data sources

docs.title: Drug
docs.text: Use drug commands for medication lookup, target-oriented search, and safety context.

docs.title: Search drugs
docs.text:
Text query:

biomcp search drug -q "kinase inhibitor" --limit 5

Target-oriented search:

biomcp search drug --target BRAF --limit 5

Indication-oriented search:

biomcp search drug --indication melanoma --limit 5

docs.title: Get a drug record
docs.text:
biomcp get drug pembrolizumab

Default output provides concise identity and mechanism context.

docs.title: Request drug sections
docs.text:
FDA label section:

biomcp get drug vemurafenib label

Shortage section:

biomcp get drug carboplatin shortage

Targets and indications sections:

biomcp get drug pembrolizumab targets
biomcp get drug pembrolizumab indications

Interactions (drug-drug interactions):

biomcp get drug vemurafenib interactions

CIViC evidence and Drugs@FDA approvals:

biomcp get drug vemurafenib civic
biomcp get drug dabrafenib approvals

docs.title: Cross-entity helpers
docs.text:
Trial pivot:

biomcp drug trials pembrolizumab --limit 5

Safety pivot:

biomcp drug adverse-events pembrolizumab --limit 5

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json get drug pembrolizumab

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Start with base get before requesting heavy sections.
  • Use target filters to narrow crowded drug classes.
  • Pair drug lookups with trial filters for protocol matching workflows.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Adverse event
  • Trial
  • Data sources

docs.title: Gene
docs.text: Use gene commands to retrieve canonical metadata and targeted biological context.

docs.title: What the gene guide covers
docs.text:
• symbol-based retrieval,
  • lightweight search,
  • section expansion,
  • JSON output for downstream systems.

docs.title: Search genes
docs.text:
Start with search when you are unsure of symbol spelling or aliases.

biomcp search gene -q BRAF --limit 5

Useful fields in search output typically include symbol, Entrez ID, and species.

docs.title: Get a gene record
docs.text:
biomcp get gene BRAF

The default gene view is concise and intended for orientation.

docs.title: Request deeper sections
docs.text:
BioMCP expands detail via positional sections.

Pathway view:

biomcp get gene BRAF pathways

Disease associations:

biomcp get gene BRAF diseases

Ontology terms:

biomcp get gene BRAF ontology

Protein summary:

biomcp get gene BRAF protein

GO terms and interactions:

biomcp get gene BRAF go interactions

CIViC evidence summary:

biomcp get gene BRAF civic

Multiple sections can be chained:

biomcp get gene BRAF pathways diseases

docs.title: Gene helper commands
docs.text:
biomcp gene trials BRAF --limit 5
biomcp gene drugs BRAF --limit 5
biomcp gene pathways BRAF
biomcp gene articles BRAF
biomcp gene definition BRAF

docs.title: Clinical trial pivot
docs.text: biomcp search trial -c melanoma --mutation "BRAF V600E" --limit 5

docs.title: Literature pivot
docs.text: biomcp search article -g BRAF -d melanoma --limit 5

docs.title: Variant pivot
docs.text: biomcp search variant -g BRAF --limit 5

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text:
Use JSON for pipelines or agent post-processing.

biomcp --json get gene BRAF

docs.title: Error handling expectations
docs.text: If a section name is unsupported, BioMCP returns an explicit unknown-section message with hints about valid section names.

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Keep section requests narrow for better focus.
  • Start with one section, then add another only if needed.
  • Use search first when symbol ambiguity is possible.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Variant
  • Article
  • Trial
  • Protein
  • Progressive disclosure

docs.title: GWAS
docs.text: Use GWAS commands to search trait-variant associations from the GWAS Catalog.

docs.title: Search GWAS
docs.text:
By trait:

biomcp search gwas --trait "type 2 diabetes" --limit 10

By gene:

biomcp search gwas -g BRAF

By genomic region:

biomcp search gwas --region "chr7:140400000-140500000" --limit 10

With p-value threshold:

biomcp search gwas -g TCF7L2 --p-value 5e-8 --limit 10

docs.title: Search filters
docs.text:
Flag Description -g/--gene Gene symbol --trait Trait or phenotype term --region Genomic region (chr:start-end) --p-value P-value significance threshold -l/--limit Max results --offset Pagination offset

GWAS is search-only. There is no get subcommand.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json search gwas --trait "type 2 diabetes"

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Combine gene and trait filters to narrow broad searches.
  • Use --region for locus-level queries when you have genomic coordinates.
  • GWAS data is also available as a variant section: biomcp get variant rs7903146 gwas.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Variant
  • Gene
  • Phenotype

docs.title: Intervention
docs.text: Use intervention commands to search clinical trial interventions from the NCI Clinical Trials Search API.

docs.title: Search interventions
docs.text:
By name:

biomcp search intervention pembrolizumab

By type:

biomcp search intervention --type drug --limit 10

By type and category:

biomcp search intervention --type drug --category "checkpoint inhibitor" --limit 10

By NCI thesaurus code:

biomcp search intervention --code C1447 --limit 5

docs.title: Search filters
docs.text:
Flag Description -q/--query Intervention name or keyword --type Intervention type (drug, device, procedure) --category Intervention category --code NCI thesaurus code -l/--limit Max results --offset Pagination offset

Intervention is search-only. There is no get subcommand.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json search intervention pembrolizumab

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Use --type drug to exclude procedures and devices from results.
  • Pair intervention searches with trial searches to find active protocols.
  • NCI thesaurus codes provide precise lookups when available.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Trial
  • Drug
  • Organization

docs.title: Organization
docs.text: Use organization commands to search research institutions and trial sites from the NCI Clinical Trials Search API.

docs.title: Search organizations
docs.text:
By name:

biomcp search organization "Dana-Farber"

By state:

biomcp search organization --state Massachusetts --limit 10

By type and city:

biomcp search organization --type academic --city Boston --limit 10

Industry organizations:

biomcp search organization --type industry --limit 10

docs.title: Search filters
docs.text:
Flag Description -q/--query Organization name or keyword --type Organization type (academic, industry) --city City name --state State or province -l/--limit Max results --offset Pagination offset

Organization is search-only. There is no get subcommand.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json search organization "Dana-Farber"

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Use --state to narrow results to a geographic area.
  • Combine --type with a query to distinguish academic medical centers from sponsors.
  • Pair organization results with trial searches to find site-specific enrollment.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Trial
  • Intervention
  • Biomarker

docs.title: Pathway
docs.text: Use pathway commands to move from pathway names/IDs to genes, events, enrichment, and drug pivots.

docs.title: Search pathways
docs.text: biomcp search pathway -q "MAPK signaling" --limit 5

docs.title: Get pathway records
docs.text: biomcp get pathway R-HSA-5673001

docs.title: Request pathway sections
docs.text:
Genes:

biomcp get pathway R-HSA-5673001 genes

Contained events:

biomcp get pathway R-HSA-5673001 events

Gene-set enrichment:

biomcp get pathway R-HSA-5673001 enrichment

docs.title: Helper commands
docs.text:
biomcp pathway drugs R-HSA-5673001 --limit 5
biomcp pathway articles R-HSA-5673001
biomcp pathway trials R-HSA-5673001

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json get pathway R-HSA-5673001 genes

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Gene
  • Drug

docs.title: PGX
docs.text: Use PGX commands to query pharmacogenomic guidelines and annotations from CPIC and PharmGKB.

docs.title: Search PGX
docs.text:
By gene:

biomcp search pgx -g CYP2D6

By drug:

biomcp search pgx -d codeine

With evidence and CPIC level filters:

biomcp search pgx -g CYP2D6 --cpic-level A --evidence --limit 10

docs.title: Search filters
docs.text: Flag Description -g/--gene Gene symbol -d/--drug Drug name --cpic-level CPIC level (A, B, C, D) --pgx-testing Filter by PGx testing recommendation --evidence Include evidence summaries -l/--limit Max results --offset Pagination offset

docs.title: Get PGX sections
docs.text:
Retrieve detailed PGX data for a gene-drug pair by section.

Dosing recommendations:

biomcp get pgx CYP2D6 recommendations

Allele frequency data:

biomcp get pgx CYP2D6 frequencies

Clinical guidelines:

biomcp get pgx CYP2D6 guidelines

PharmGKB annotations:

biomcp get pgx CYP2D6 annotations

All sections at once:

biomcp get pgx CYP2D6 all

docs.title: Available sections
docs.text: Section Content recommendations CPIC dosing recommendations frequencies Allele frequency data guidelines Published clinical guidelines annotations PharmGKB clinical annotations all All sections combined

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text:
biomcp --json search pgx -g CYP2D6
biomcp --json get pgx CYP2D6 recommendations

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Gene
  • Drug
  • Variant

docs.title: Phenotype
docs.text: Use phenotype commands to search HPO terms and phenotype-gene associations from the Monarch Initiative.

docs.title: Search phenotypes
docs.text:
By HPO identifiers (space-separated):

biomcp search phenotype "HP:0001250 HP:0001263"

By name or keyword:

biomcp search phenotype seizure

Multiple terms with limit:

biomcp search phenotype "HP:0001250 HP:0001263" --limit 20

docs.title: Search filters
docs.text:
Flag Description terms Positional: HPO IDs or keywords (space/comma separated) -l/--limit Max results --offset Pagination offset

Phenotype is search-only. There is no get subcommand.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json search phenotype "HP:0001250"

docs.title: Practical tips
docs.text:
• Use HPO IDs for precise lookups when you know the exact term.
  • Use plain-text keywords for exploratory searches across phenotype names.
  • Combine multiple HPO IDs in a single query to retrieve a phenotype set.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Gene
  • Disease
  • GWAS

docs.title: Protein
docs.text: Use protein commands to query UniProt accessions and expand into domains, interactions, and structure IDs.

docs.title: Search proteins
docs.text: biomcp search protein -q kinase --limit 5

docs.title: Get protein records
docs.text: biomcp get protein P15056

docs.title: Request protein sections
docs.text:
Domains:

biomcp get protein P15056 domains

Interactions:

biomcp get protein P15056 interactions

Structures:

biomcp get protein P15056 structures

docs.title: Helper command
docs.text: biomcp protein structures P15056

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json get protein P15056 all

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• Gene
  • Pathway

docs.title: Trial
docs.text: Use trial commands to search and inspect clinical studies with oncology-focused filters.

docs.title: Trial command model
docs.text:
• search trial finds candidate studies.
  • get trial <NCT_ID> retrieves a specific study.
  • positional sections expand details.

docs.title: Search trials (default source)
docs.text:
ClinicalTrials.gov is the default source.

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --status recruiting --limit 5

Add intervention and phase filters:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma -i pembrolizumab --phase 3 --limit 5

Add biomarker filters:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --mutation "BRAF V600E" --limit 5
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --biomarker BRAF --limit 5

Geographic filtering:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --lat 42.36 --lon -71.06 --distance 50 --limit 5

When geo filters are set, the search query summary includes lat, lon, and distance.

Prior-therapy filters:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --prior-therapies platinum --limit 5
biomcp search trial -c melanoma --line-of-therapy 2L --limit 5

docs.title: Search trials (NCI source)
docs.text:
Use NCI CTS when needed:

biomcp search trial -c melanoma --source nci --limit 5

For higher limits/reliability, set NCI_API_KEY.

docs.title: Get a trial by NCT ID
docs.text:
biomcp get trial NCT02576665

The default response summarizes title, status, condition context, and source metadata.

docs.title: Request trial sections
docs.text:
Eligibility:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 eligibility

Locations:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 locations

Outcomes:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 outcomes

Arms/interventions:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 arms

References:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 references

All sections where supported:

biomcp get trial NCT02576665 all

docs.title: Downloaded text and cache
docs.text: Large text blocks (for example, eligibility text) are cached in the BioMCP download area. This keeps repeated lookups responsive.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text: biomcp --json get trial NCT02576665

docs.title: Trial matching tips
docs.text:
• Start broad on condition, then add intervention and biomarker filters.
  • Keep limits low while tuning search criteria.
  • Use eligibility section only when you need raw criteria text.

docs.title: Related guides
docs.text:
• How to find trials
  • Disease
  • Drug

docs.title: Variant
docs.text: Use variant commands for compact annotation, source-backed interpretation context, and optional predictive and population-genetics sections.

docs.title: Accepted variant identifiers
docs.text:
BioMCP supports multiple input forms:

  • rsID: rs113488022
  • HGVS genomic: chr7:g.140453136A>T
  • gene-protein form: BRAF V600E

docs.title: Get a variant record
docs.text:
biomcp get variant rs113488022
biomcp get variant "chr7:g.140453136A>T"
biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E"

The default output favors concise, clinically relevant context first.

docs.title: Request variant sections
docs.text:
Prediction section:

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" predict

ClinVar-focused section:

biomcp get variant rs113488022 clinvar

Population section:

biomcp get variant "chr7:g.140453136A>T" population

CIViC section:

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" civic

GWAS section (trait associations from GWAS Catalog):

biomcp get variant rs7903146 gwas

Predictions (aggregated prediction scores):

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" predictions

Conservation (GERP, phyloP):

biomcp get variant rs113488022 conservation

COSMIC (somatic mutation data):

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" cosmic

CGI (Cancer Genome Interpreter annotations):

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" cgi

cBioPortal (frequency data):

biomcp get variant "BRAF V600E" cbioportal

All supported sections:

biomcp get variant rs113488022 all

docs.title: Helper commands
docs.text:
biomcp variant articles "BRAF V600E"
biomcp variant oncokb "BRAF V600E"   # requires ONCOKB_TOKEN

docs.title: Search variants
docs.text:
By gene and protein change:

biomcp search variant -g BRAF --hgvsp V600E --limit 5

By significance:

biomcp search variant -g BRCA1 --significance pathogenic --limit 5

With population and score filters:

biomcp search variant -g BRCA1 --max-frequency 0.01 --min-cadd 20 --limit 5

docs.title: Search GWAS associations
docs.text:
By gene:

biomcp search gwas -g TCF7L2 --limit 10

By trait:

biomcp search gwas --trait "type 2 diabetes" --limit 10

Trait search uses GWAS Catalog trait endpoints first, then study-association fallback paths when needed.

docs.title: Optional enrichment
docs.text: Variant base output may include cBioPortal enrichment when available. OncoKB is accessed explicitly via biomcp variant oncokb "<gene> <variant>" and requires ONCOKB_TOKEN.

docs.title: Prediction requirements
docs.text: Prediction sections may require ALPHAGENOME_API_KEY depending on source path. Unsupported inputs are surfaced with explicit validation messages.

docs.title: JSON mode
docs.text:
biomcp --json get variant "BRAF V600E"
biomcp --json get variant rs7903146 gwas
biomcp --json search gwas --trait "type 2 diabetes"
